item.title: Social science research methods seminar
item.description: Intro In this course, students will learn social science research methods to conduct original research on a topic of their choice. Students are introduced to wrangling and visualizing data in R, with no coding background required. Our brief survey of qualitative methods includes purposive sampling, semi-structured interviews, open-coding, thematic analysis, and the matrix method. Read my reflections on the Summer 2022 course here. Day 1 Day 2 Day 3 Day 4

item.title: Research methods with youth
item.description: Intro In the summer of 2022, I taught a social science research methods seminar for a high school program called STEP at Baruch College. View my curriculum here. Coding in R RStudio Cloud is an incredibly helpful tool for teaching R. It allows anyone to access the RStudio IDE directly from a browser for free. The free version more than suffices for any individual user, including all of my students. However it only allows for sharing projects between a maximum of 5 members, with a project limit of 10.
